Posts.Content: One way of putting it would be what if this happens again to you in 3 years you will say what if I had taken the chemo. At least if you take the chemo you will never have to think that. It is tough but not like it was 20 years ago. I even managed to work through mine.  If you had a bad prognosis surely then you would question more harsh treatments but sounds as if things are pretty positive for you . Good luck xxx
Posts.Title: To Chemo or not to chemo - that is the question?

Posts.Content: No its OK. I started in August and at first I found it so dreadful. The nights were still so hot and my office was hot and it felt like the last exhausting straw on this journey. I dont think it helped that after the chemo and radio you are so run down. However over the months I have got used to it. I have changed my nightwear completely. There is a thing called a chillow you can buy - I have not got one but people think they are fab. At the end of the day the other reply is right it is just our menopause but full on at once. I have got a cream from my doc for my skin. Two of my friends were post menopausal and put on different drugs which caused them muscular pain but when they told their oncologist their drug was changed in fact one finds Tamoxifen better than the rest. If you approach it as something that was coming to us anyway with age and go with the flow you will get there - just another step in this journey...an added benefit for me at least - no periods (-:
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen It Sounds Awful Is it Really That Bad?

Posts.Content: I had a port fitted privately and I have to say of all my decisions it was my worst one. My port moved every time they tried to use it and I was like a pincushion on occasion. I endede up in x ray theatre for accesssing of it every time I had my chemo.....When it was taken out I needed another cut to deal with all the scar tissue that had built up. I now have on top of everything else an extra scar and a lovely mark on my nexk where it was. At the end of teh day I had a sore chest from teh port, a sore neck and still had a sore arm form where I had my initial chemos...so be careful what you wish for the grass is not always greener....

Posts.Content: in the summer I wore nothing and now I have some cotton PJ bottoms from M&S and separate vests. Also rather than go to bed straight after my bath I let myself cool down.
